question: Although you have never formally studied computing, you have always been interested in computers. You have just read about a computer course that really interests you, but it is only for people who have completed an elementary course.Write a letter to the college enrolment officer. In your letterexplain why you are writingdescribe your circumstancesask if a special exception can be made for you so you can enroll in the course
text: I am writing in connection with the advertisement placed by your training centre about the computer course starting next month, I have found interest in this subject and would like to enrol for it. However, in the past, I have missed an opportunity to finish the elementary sessions mandatory  for the current training, I would be grateful to know if there is any possibility to consider such candidates.

The year the elementary computer course was conducted, I have been registered to it and was ready to attend the orientation. Suddenly, I went through a serious medical emergency because of which I had lost an opportunity to complete it.

Nonetheless, I have managed to cover all the basic subjects covered in the previous sessions, offline. I assure you that there wouldn't be any problem because of me in the class, and I will put an extra effort to understand and practice everything taught. I kindly request you to consider my application for the training and give me an exception.
I have attached my application to this letter for your reference. I look forward to hearing from you.
